title: The great computer science exodus (and where students are going instead)
summary: Students are losing some interest in computer science broadly but gaining interest in AI-specific majors and courses.

summary: The Department of Homeland Security has been increasing pressure on tech companies to identify the owners of accounts that criticize ICE.

summary: Elon Musk is “actively” working to make xAI’s Grok chatbot “more unhinged, according to a former employee.

summary: This week, Alta unveiled its first integration collaboration, teaming up with Public School, a storied New York City brand.

title: Hollywood isn’t happy about the new Seedance 2.0 video generator
summary: Hollywood organizations are pushing back against a new AI video model called Seedance 2.0, which they say has quickly become a tool for “blatant” copyright infringement.

summary: Designer Kate Barton teams up with Fiducia AI and IBM for a NYFW presentation.

title: Nothing opens its first retail store in India
summary: The two-story location will sell products from Nothing and the more affordable, mass-market brand CMF.

title: Indian pharmacy chain giant exposed customer data and internal systems
summary: A backend flaw in web admin dashboards used by one of India's largest pharmacy chains, exposed thousands of online pharmacy orders.

summary: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said the company wants to increase its use of large language models for customer discovery, support and engineering.

title: Airbnb says a third of its customer support is now handled by AI in the US and Canada
summary: Airbnb was poised to introduce an app that doesn't just search for you, but one that "knows you." CEO Brian Chesky said, "It will help guests plan their entire trip, help hosts better run their businesses, and help the company operate more efficiently at scale."

summary: The company said hackers downloaded “a limited number of files” after breaking into an employee’s account. The hacking group ShinyHunters took responsibility for the breach.
